p: Monitoring reports demonstrated that subgenogroup B1 and B2 predominated in America and Europe in the 1970s [ 45]. During the 80s, B2 was introduced into the United States, the Netherlands, Australia, and Japan [ 45]. In the early 1990s, a shift was observed in which subgenogroup C1 replaced B2 as the predominant genotype [ 45]. In contrast, subgenogroup B3 appears to be extinct since representatives of genotype in Singapore has not been found since 1999. Between 2000 and 2010, C2 was the predominant subgenogroup observed in AFP surveillance in Philippines [ 108]. Subgenogroup C3 was only isolated in South Korea in 2000 with sporadic cases (TableÂ 1) [ 109].
